latex: Prove that there exists a nonzero complex number $c$ and a real number $d$ such that \[\left|\left|\dfrac1{1+z+z^2}\right|-\left|\dfrac1{1+z+z^2}-c\right|\right|=d\] for all $z$ with $|z|=1$ and $1+z+z^2\neq 0$.  (Here, $|z|$ denotes the absolute value of the complex number $z$, so that $|a+bi|=\sqrt{a^2+b^2}$ for real numbers $a,b$.)
